subject: Home & DIY
title: Le Corbusier's Five Points
description: A quick, practical guide to Le Corbusier's Five Points.

hook.text: In 1926, Le Corbusier published five rules for modern architecture. They rejected everything buildings had been.

buildup.text: His five points: pilotis (stilts), free plan, free facade, ribbon windows, and a roof garden.

discovery.text: Lifting buildings on stilts freed the ground floor. Removing load-bearing walls freed the interior layout entirely.

twist.text: Critics called his designs cold and inhuman. Residents of his UnitÃ© d'Habitation protested living there.

climax.text: Love or hate him, Le Corbusier's ideas shaped every glass office tower and apartment block you see today.

punchline.text: Five rules reshaped every city skyline.

quiz.question: What are 'pilotis' in Le Corbusier's five points?
options: Stilts that raise a building off the ground
